### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:The crowd wasn't that big. His clothes would be the only thing you would be able to identify him by.<n><n>Input:Richard asks Hurley what his favorite colors are, so Hurley tells him Orange. They sit next to each other and talk for an hour. Richard asks Hurley if he likes Pink and Hurley tells him he likes Pink. Richard then asks Hurley if he doesn't like Pink so Hurley says "no." Richard then asks Hurley about his favorite color and Hurley replies "I don't like orange." Richard is puzzled and asks Hurley "Why?" Hurley replies "I'm allergic to it." Richard is very confused and asks Hurley why he'd be allergic to it. Hurley then says "I don't like me." Richard asks Hurley how he can be allergic to something he never tried. Hurley replies "Well, I was wearing it." Richard then asks Hurleys why he says 'I'm allergic to me' instead of saying 'I'm a little weird,' which makes Richard very suspicious. Hurley explains that he used to wear Orange whenever there was a party so that the people close to him wouldn't be allergic to it. That led to him being allergic to him. Richard wants to know if Hurley knew this at the time or ever noticed him wearing orange or if he has been wearing Orange all his life. Hurley replies "No, I didn't know that was what made me allergic to me." Richard makes the statement 'That boy was born with a silver tongue, and a silver tongue likes his food.' ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What might the inability to learn cause? Choices:  A: intelligence B: education C: effectiveness D: distress E: a stupid<n>Output:		 What happened to poor Pablo who had to go to the car wash? He had to pay $200 to wash his car. He also forgot to bring any money with him. How many times was he washing his car? 3 times because that is how many times he washed it since he wasn’t paid enough to wash it twice. How many times was it on the weekend? Sunday. What does Pablo do when he is not washing his car? Swirl? Swish? Swirl? What is wrong with this answer? It is not consistent with the amount of washing Pablo does to pay for the car wash and because he can’t remember to bring $2 with him to pay the car wash.<n><n>Input: A is a student who is struggling to learn. His parents are very good at math. B is a student who is studying hard. C is a student who studied hard. D is a student who does not study hard. E is a student who does better then the others on tests. F is a student who is failing and is getting a failing grade. Give A’s parents a piece of paper reading “There is one mistake A is making. I think this person is F”. Give C’s parents a sheet of paper reading “C has a problem with learning. I think this person should be G”. Give D’s parents a paper reading “D has to learn quickly. I think that someone should be I”.<n>What do the papers say? You only need A to get a B. B can pass with a good grade. C can get an A but needs to study more. D can study less, but needs to learn fast. E is failing and should be I.<n>What happens to A? He gets a B and is A grade higher then D. What happens to C? He keeps his grade lower then A and keeps passing with a B. He even gets an A. He is happy with passing. What happens to D? His grade drops a little, due to the fact that he does not study as hard as the others. His parents don’t realize how hard he studies. What happens to F? He gets an A and will pass, even though he doesn’t study as hard as the other students. They are both happy with their grades.<n>What happens to E? He is not in school. He is living in his house with his parents. He doesn’t study
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:A small dog is lost in New England, where would it likely be found? Choices:  A: own home B: old england C: new hampshire D: coffin E: denmark<n>Output:		A dog is found in england. The dog's owner is happy about his purchase.<n><n>Input:If the person's left eye is 20 centimeters away from the person's right eye (if the person's right cheek are touching a mirror), how long until the person will be able to see?<n>Output:A person with no left eye is able to see within.25 meters. If he/she was to bend more than 45 degrees, he/she should be able to see up to six meters. So the person's distance from the wall is.25 x 6 = 6 meters. So the person can see up to 6 meters from a mirror without bending.<n><n>Input:What is the approximate distance between the eyes on the head of a man?<n>Output:A man with 20/5=5 eyes is able to distinguish colors easily.<n><n>Output:Let's say there are ten people in a room. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What body of water is typically shallow water? Choices:  A: lake B: aquariums C: swimming pool D: pond E: childrens pools<n>Output:		 B<n><n>Input: Which of the following is the worst year for hurricanes? (12 x 7)<n><n>Input:<n>Input:<n>Input:(1) You have a set of 10 pairs of socks. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:James wanted to stop competing.  What might he have been feeling? Choices:  A: pressure B: death C: trying harder D: quitting E: winning or losing<n>Output:		  No one wants to compete against him. B A D E<n>Solution:  A B D E<n>The first problem is about pressuring. James feels the pressure and is unable to make his way without pressure. James is losing, but refuses to quit and refuses to die.   The second problem shows that you can quit by trying harder to try winning.  James can't seem to win so he tries harder to win and dies.<n>The last problem shows that pressure causes dying. James dies, but at least he tried his best to try and win.<n>To sum it up: James wanted to quit, so that's why he wanted to stop competing. He felt the pressure and made himself win. He tried harder to win after the fact.<n><n>Input:James thought about having his girlfriend come with him to the beach to take pictures.  What was his reaction?<n>Output:The group of friends agreed to be the photographer for the day and gave James the money to cover the trip. James had no money to pay for his girlfriend.   The only thing that James could do was to tell his girlfriend that he was going to leave with one of his friends.  She agreed and came with the group. James still had money for her, but he had no idea where he was going to get another $50.  If he could not come up with any money by the time they left, his girlfriend would have to find work and the group would lose the money they agreed to pay him.<n>The group of friends was afraid of losing the money because it was from a school project. James wanted to go to the beach and take pictures, so he would still have a camera to take the pictures with along with him.  He did not feel pressure because he didn't have to pay for anything because of the school project.  He just felt that his friends felt bad about losing money because they knew that he was going to have to pay for something.<n>The group left the school and went down to the pier. Once they were able to find someone who would take pictures for them, James was asked to take pictures of them with the camera. James felt pressured because it was the first time he was going to have someone other than his friends take pictures of him.  He knew that someone would not be able to take good quality pictures. James felt anxious that the pictures would not be good.  Since no one paid for his girlfriend, he was forced to take pictures of his girlfriend and his friends.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Where is a bay always found? Choices:  A: lake B: manhattan C: shoreline D: coastal area E: los angeles<n>Output:		 A<n><n>Input:<n>How was the wind blowing during the last time Richard looked out of his room window?<n> output: 3<n><n>Input:<n>What is the difference between 2+1 and 4+2?<n> output: 4<n><n>Input:<n>Which of the following is a negative number and which is a positive number?<n> output: -3<n><n>Input:The total number of animals that died in an earthquake is 13. How many animals have died in two hours?<n> Output: 3<n><n>Input and Output:1- 3- 7- 8- 1- 2<n>Input:How many hours were there since the last time you watched TV?<n>Output: 27 1/2 hours<n><n>Input:<n>Who was going to be the next CEO of a company after Dick?<n>Output:<n><n>Input:<n>If you had $1,000 to buy a book, what would it be (excluding the initial price)?<n>Output: $300<n><n>Input:<n>The Earth is 4,000,000,000 miles long. If there are 30 feet between every other house, what width should a fence be?<n>Output: 2 feet<n><n>Input:<n>To get the answers from the first three questions, put in your response in the comments.<n>Input: If Jane and Bob will pay you two cents each per book you read, how much will they pay you if you read their entire stack?<n>Output: $20 + 2 cents = $<<2*20=48>>48<n>So the seven friends will pay you $108.50. Also, if you read the books twice, that would be $12.50 ($12 for two books).<n>The total is $108.50.<n>Input:<n><n>Input:What is the difference between 1+1 and 2+1?<n>Output: 2<n><n>Input:<n>For each question on this page you have to write a paragraph.<n>Output:<n>The number of books in their stack is [2* [4 + 4 - 28 - [12 - 12 + 9 - 9 - 9 - 4]], where 0 is the first book and 1 is the last.<n><n>Input:<n>Take a square of 1/4 inch plywood and fold it into quarters. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. D, E = dull<n>Subtract the 2 answers to get 20.<n><n>Input: John’s father asked the kids if they would like to buy some shoes from him. John’s father wanted them to get one pair each. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. Choices:  A: make noise B: have tea C: make time D: make payments E: take time<n>Output:		 A: make noise B : tea C : payments D : time E: take time<n><n>Input: The person who will use your credit card to order a large pizza can make $0.02 per transaction or $12 per day. Which one of these will be more profitable?<n>output: Make pizza first, earn 0.02/0.03 = $0.02/0.0067 = [0.02/0 = 0.02]$0.017<n>Make salad first, earn 0.03/0.0067 - $0.02/1 = [0.03/0 = 0.03]$0.03<n>Make pizza second, earn 0.03 + 5 = [0.03 + 5 = 5] = [0.03 - 3 = 3]$0.03+10 = [3 + 3 = 10]$0.03 - 15 = [3 + 150 = 15]$0.03 + 200 = [3 + 150 + 200 = 200]$0.03/2 = $0.03/17 = [0.03 / 200 = [0.03 * 5 = 5]/2]%<n>Make salad, earn 0.04/5 - $0.03/10 = [0.04 / 5 = 5] = $0.04 + [0.03 / 3 = 3] = [0.04 - 50 = [0.04*3 = 5]50]$0.03*500 = [0.04 + 3 + 2*500 = 3]500*2 = [3 + 2 + 4*500 = 4]2<n>Make pizza, earn 1/5 - 40/2 = [0.14 + $0.02 + 1 / 10 = 40 + 100]$0.0 - 150 = {40 - 75 + 2}/2 = [1 + 2 + 6 / 10 = 6 + 90]$70 - 150 = [150 - 70 = 150]<n>Make salad, earn 9/5 - 40/3 = [0.2 + [0.2 + 0.2 + 0.35 = 5]$0.2 + 0 + [0 + 0.36 = 5]$0<n>Make pizza, earn [0.07+0.18*10 = 5] - [0
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:When she went to examine the thing, what was she considering doing with it? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. Choices:  A: ignore B: enforce C: authoritarian D: yell at E: avoid<n>Output:		 They can’t do that<n>That’s why I say it works as a punishment, but it can’t change the culture (because the culture has been shaped by the sanctions).<n>Maybe the sanctions only hurt and they can’t do anything because they haven’t been set free yet. I would say it might work, but I think the answer in this situation is that they can definitely change the sanctions before freedom, and thus a culture change is not possible.<n><n>Input:The President of a school asked its principal to find out the number of teachers, the average class size, the average amount of time wasted on paper etc. The teacher spent months looking but couldn't find anything. But the fact that it takes so long suggests someone is trying to manipulate the results. How can that be?<n>Output: A. Someone’s trying to manipulate the results B. He can’t find it C. It is impossible to measure due to lack of time D. The Principal knows what teachers are like but doesn’t want to publicize it<n><n>Output:The results of your test are a 4, and your first grade grade is a 4. You decide that you will continue writing more challenging tests to see if you can get a 6 or a 7, or will you change to another grade at school?<n>Output:I will start writing a 4 again. I haven’t made enough progress.<n>You can’t expect to get higher grades unless the quality of your work increases, and the teacher agrees that your best work will improve.<n><n>Input:What should be the name of a band?<n>Output: What should be the name of the band?<n>The band is The Hives.<n><n>Output:He is very happy he is a professional. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:To locate a choker not located in a jewelry box or boutique where would you go? Choices:  A: jewelry store B: neck C: jewlery box D: jewelry box E: boutique<n>Output:		The one the necklace is not in, necklace is 1 = jewelry box<n>The necklace is in, necklace is 2 = Necklace
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:The fox walked from the city into the forest, what was it looking for? Because the people aren't in their houses on the beach, you can't really see the animals. The animals like to be near people and they feel safer near people. They live in houses on the beach because they are safer that way. They can go where they want and they aren't afraid of predators and they get to eat and play. If people were actually on the beach most of it wouldn't matter the animals lived there, but because they live on the beach it matters.<n>Input: You are invited to a barbecue while you are on vacation<n>Output: You are completely lost
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What is it called when you slowly cook using a grill? Choices:  A: backyard B: restaurant C: crockpot D: neighbor's house E: barbeque<n>Output:		It is called a barbeque!!!!!!<n><n>In this scenario, two groups of children are going to eat at one restaurant. One group will be able to order food ahead of time and the other group will have to order it on the day of the visit. You tell them each to describe what their friends will be ordering. You tell them all their choices.<n>Input: The food order is on the left. The restaurant's name and price are on the right.<n>Output: When the group arrives at the restaurant, the children order food that is part of their group’s order.<n><n>Input: What is the name of the restaurant? Do they call it "Chocolate" or "Chocolatey?"<n><n>Output: It is "Chocolatey."<n><n>Input: What did the children order from the "Chocolatey" restaurant? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Where would you expect to find a pizzeria while shopping? Choices:  A: chicago B: street C: little italy D: food court E: capital cities<n>Output:		 There would be one pizza shop or pizza place in our area. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What does playing soccer for a long time lead to? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Where in Southern Europe would you find many canals? How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:A fox was thirsty searching for water during the drought, where was he? Choices:  A: painting B: hen house C: california D: virginia E: movie hall<n>Output:		 A: painting B: California: Virginia C: Virginia D: movie halls<n>If the fox was not thirsty, you would have no other choice than to pick the water.<n><n>Input:A scientist found a small rock in the mud and took a picture of it. He brought it back to the laboratory with the rock. The next day, he took the rock back to the laboratory and took a picture of the same rock again. The scientist saw that the rock didn't change a lot. Was the rock always so smooth or did it just get darker over the years?<n>Output: A: Smooth B: Dark C: Light D: Smooth or Dark<n>The scientist took the rock from the mud again. He took the photo again. This time, he saw a small change in the picture. Was the rock always smooth or was it just got darker over the years? So the final answer is dark<n><n>Input:Him and Jim had a disagreement. Jim wanted to show him how to use PowerPoint. During the teaching process, Jim found a lot of mistakes. What did the teacher do?<n>Output: He explained the mistake. After showing the mistake many times, Jim decided to give up and to leave. The teacher did not give up because not many students would do that.<n>So the final solution is to tell the teacher how to use powerpoint<n><n>Input:The student had been told that she had to stay overnight at her grandparents’ house. Her grandfather told her not to worry because she would feel safe. The next morning, she and her grandfather were going to take pictures of a local mountain for her grandpa. When she asked her parents if she could stay with her grandpa, they agreed because they knew their grandparents were probably asleep.<n>Output: His grandson feels safe with the relative; he does not feel safe staying alone.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:The sensor would just the distance then set off an alarm, the installation expert explained it was called a what kind of sensor? Choices:  A: near B: closeness C: here D: proximity E: this<n>Output:		A sensor only sees if the distance is less than 10 meters.<n><n>Input:The group of six friends decided to buy a car. They decided that each friend should pay $1200 for the car. The six friends divided the cost equally, $200 / 2 = $<<200/2=400>>400.<n>So the final four people will share the savings of the car.<n>So after the six friends decided that each person should have a share of this savings, they should divide the costs equally and $200 / 2 = 200/2 = 40/2. So they should each pay $40 / 2 = $40/2 = $200. So the final answer is $200<n><n>Input:A group of six friends decided that they should each pay $1500 for a car. The group has been searching for a car for four years, they have a total of $15k. Each friend in the group is saving $1000 for two years, they each receive $1500. For example, when the final friend decides to buy a car, they divide the cost equally $1500/2 = $<<1500/2=1200>>1200. So the final four people will now have $600 saved. So the six friends are now saved $800 and $1200 so a net saving of $1200. Thus they are now equal, saving $1200, therefore they should split the saving equal between themselves. So the final four must pay $1200 / 2 = $100/2 = $200/ 2. So the final four have to pay $200 / 2 = >>200/ 2 = $400 so the final four have to share their savings at $200 / 2 = <<200/2=100>>100. So the final four should each pay $40/2 = >>40/ 2 = $160 so the final four have share $160/2 = $<<160/2=75>>75. So the final four now jointly share in the savings, thus the final four now have $200/2 = <<200/2 = 75>>75 sharing their savings equally for the net savings of $150, thus they should be equal, saving an equal share in the savings, $150<n>So the final answer to this is 125<n><n>Input:Two people are at a store when a customer comes in and starts to buy groceries. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:The evacuation became mandatory, so what came on the TV? Choices:  A: advisory B: mandate C: soap opera D: elective E: optional<n>Output:		 None of the options came on the TV<n><n>Input: The number of people in the house depends on the cost.<n>Output: None of these will work as the numbers are close, so a new equation will be needed.<n>Input: Cost = CostOfFood(FoodCost)<n>Output:Cost = CostOfWater(WaterCost)<n>So we want to know how much food and how much water are needed to feed one person for 24 hours. We need to calculate CostOfFood and CostOfWater (and the number of people that the food will feed).<n>So first we take the FoodCost and add it to CostOfWater. Then we subtract CostOfFood. And then we sum CostOfFood to CostOfWater.<n>If we had $1000 in our house then we'd subtract Cost ofWater - CostOfFood to find that CostOfFood would be $300. Since we have only $99 in our house, we'll use the $99 cost.<n>Now we take the other two costs. CostOfFood = CostOfWater + CostOfFood. Now we subtract $300 - $99 from CostOfFood.<n>If we subtract $300 from CostOfWater, we take the other $300 from CostOfFood. Then we add the remaining $900 to the other two costs to calculate the $1200 CostOfFood and $1200 CostOfWater. Finally we round up to the nearest dollar and divide the remaining $900.<n>Now, we simply find the total of $1200 in our house, and divide it by $1200/6 = $1200/36 hours. That gives us the number of people that our food will feed. And then we take the number of people that Water will feed, and figure OutWhatIf which is the number of people that we think we'd lose if our power and our water went out, and divide by the number of hours that our food will feed them.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:They decided to hash things out over drinks, after enough booze they were able to get close on a few things and what? Choices:  A: reach tentative agreement B: suicide C: examine thing D: commit murder E: stay in bed<n>Output:		 The results are the same B, D, and E<n>The agreement is reached D and E<n>What were the conclusions of the discussion<n><n>Input:The group were going to get together at a party to celebrate the New Year's Eve. A couple had to be left out because of the party being so big. How many participants will be there?A: 100B: 60C: 30D: 10E: 15<n>Output: As usual.<n>The list of participants will be the following: A will attend, B will join, C will NOT attend, D will NOT be there<n><n>input: The party is at 8pm. Everyone at home wants to watch the new year's eve ball drop. There are no partygoers in school. The rest of the party goes on without them at 8. The school day ends at 3pm. If no one is home by the party, where will the ball drop?A: In the front yard, B will be left at home, C will leave school, D will stay home<n>Output: Ball will drop in the front yard.<n>Input: Two members of the group are out of town and could only join late on a Wednesday. Which members will be left out for the Thursday school play?A: B<n>Output: B's last role is to make a welcome for the other members.<n>Output: The other members will also be asked to make a welcome for B.<n>Input: One member of the group is out of town and cannot make it to the party for Thursday night's play. Which other members are they? A: D<n>Output: Not all members will be out on Thursday night.<n>Input: In their last role on Thursday night, B will try to put together a good welcome for the other people in their group who are not at the party. Which other members will help them make this welcome?A: D<n>Output: D will make a welcome for the four members of their group.<n>Output: The four members of the group will also make a welcome for B and their group.<n>Input: In the second role on Thursday night, D will try to convince people to stay sober, while B will prepare a welcome for the other three non-partying members of their group. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Can you name a good reason for attending school? Choices:  A: get smart B: boredom C: colds and flu D: taking tests E: spend time<n>Output:		Answer: 1. The reason for schooling is to increase opportunities for you to get better grades so that you can get a job. 2. School isn't going to increase your opportunities to obtain a better job. You're not going to learn much in school at your level. 3. School has to do with teaching so it is supposed to increase your ability to learn. 4. If your parents can't afford to pay for yourself you need help, but that can be provided at home by your teachers, but school is not that kind of help. Determination is needed to help students become good at school. 5. School has to help you become a better worker. If you have to put up with other kids in your class, that is a part of schooling. If you find a good teacher that can help you study, homework and prepare for tests, your schooling will get considerably easier. 6. It doesn't pay to be lazy. Your parents will have to help pay for you to be well educated. Determination should be rewarded. You have to do your best work and keep working hard in school for all of your efforts.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Though she made the cut years ago, its figurative scars would never what? Choices:  A: joining B: put together C: stitch D: heal E: paste<n>Output:		 though she made the cut years agos she still has a scar.<n><n>Input:The man of the house wants to do some landscaping, so he calls his son, and a man named Ted. What is the difference in their time sheets?<n>Output: Their timesheets do not differ much.<n>If both jobs took no more than 15 minutes, then they should be able to add up their difference in time sheets to make 15 minutes/20 minutes = 10 minutes. The compartment with the groceries would be the food compartment. The person who originally turned down the $1000 bonus, who was later chosen as a replacement, received an additional $3000. So, in the end, he received $3600 in prize money.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:James felt himself losing consciousness. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. Choices:  A: backery B: ham sandwich C: fridge D: butcher shop E: freezer<n>Output:		 It does last an eternity if stored correctly.<n><n>Input: Where did the word "nausea" come from? Choose this answer if you know the origin: "Nausea is a symptom of a serious medical condition — vomiting — usually accompanied by abdominal pain and nausea. It occurs when the digestive system is not receiving enough nutrients for proper digestion and functioning. [1]. The word "nausea," derived from the Latin noun nausea, originally meant "a feeling of sick or sickening." It entered common parlance in mid-18th century France in the context of food as an ill-effects of eating; its first documented use was in the 1750s in a translation of Cicero's Politics.[1] It is unclear when the expression "nausea," coined when the word "nause" was used as a noun, became used to refer to a specific cause, but it is fairly widespread today. "It has been argued that the first recorded use of the term "nausea" in literature was in the English poet John Keats' first-century poem, The Odyssey, where it means "fear, trembling or ill." [1]<n>Output: "Nausea" was a part of the common lexicological lexicon by the late 18th century. In the 1860s, "nausea," as a noun, refers to "a severe vomiting and diarrhea episode." [4][3] In the 1930s, it was commonly used as a noun describing diarrhea. [5] Usage began to decline in the 1950s and 1960s; by the 1970s, the term had disappeared from use.[6]<n><n>Input: A person was born blind and his mother said he would never read books, as he was not a "bookworm" (from a French bookworm "to understand how books are written") but he loved to be around books. How could I be born blind and not be educated around books? I will never read."<n>But when the grandmother thought it over, she remembered that she had not read himself a book since she was a child. She thought to her self: "How stupid of me not to have read myself a

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Where do bees congregate with red flowerS? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:It was a great rest, she had never felt this much what in the morning? A: In the long jump the goal is to land three different times (four if you are a sprinter), so the time it takes for an athlete to jump is usually around one minute. The distance in the short jump is usually around five yards. A long jump is a race. There is a goal of landing four different times in the race. If you do not land, no longer than 3 times, your time is wasted. If you land less than 3 times in the race, that means you need to improve your technique, work out more, etc.<n>Output: In the long jump, the goal is to land four times (four if you will be a sprinter). So the time it takes for the athlete to jump is usually one minute. The distance is usually three yards. Therefore, the overall time to complete an event is about 4 minutes.<n>Output: When in the
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:If I had a jar which was likely to spoil if left out, where would I want to put it? If there is a jar not in pantry then put that there.<n><n>Input: If I had two houses, one of them was in foreclosure. If I decided to sell the house, how much would it be worth? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What will happen to skin pinched in something? If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. This was the beginning of nutrient management. They monitored the health of the animals by checking the number of cattle, calves, calves left, calves died, milk and milk proteins. In time, the feed became a significant amount of the farm's income and so the farmer decided to continue the testing. Since you have to walk for 1/3 of your day, the stones accumulated from walking amount to 1000. What is a cube of 1000?<n>Output: 1000/30=7000<n>So 1000 stones would require 7,000 of walking every day.<n>The amount of stone is 0.67 * 2 days x 1000 * 3 days = 20,000 days of walking.<n>The average person walks 10,000 days of the year.<n>So at the beginning, you had to walk 7,000 times to accumulate 20,000 stones.<n>Now you have walked 17,500 times to collect the same amount.<n>So you will get your money out of the stone. So the final answer is 17,500<n><n>Input: A pair of shoes is sold at $100. The store sells a pair of shoes that costs $50. With two pairs of shoes, only one of the pair cost any money. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:The new play was the go to performance of the year, all the crowds would stand and what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:He had done a great job with the scary decorations, they were completely what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:If you tell you boss your suffering from boredom they'll likely tell you to get back to what?
