The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What kind of people will someone who is in charge of project look for? Choices:  A: greedy B: worry C: have knowledge D: take charge E: boss<n>Output:		 When in charge, leader will look for greedy, worry, greedy, greedy, greedy and take charge<n><n>Instructions:<n>1. First, decide on the two types of people.<n><n>2. Find the answer for the question<n><n>Input:Pablo and the other two are from the same class. Each knows he is very smart and will be able to get his grade up to a A on this quiz. Pablo will ask Hurley to give him his homework assignment for the next 5 days. He will also be very nice to the other two boys and try to encourage them to help out by bringing them some treats when they need it. Hurley, however, is very mean-spirited and will ask Pablo to do the homework by himself. Hurley would also ask Pablo to go over his assignment with the teacher. Pablo would tell him he will do the assignment the best he can or that he needs help, but Hurley would tell Pablo to take it all on himself and he won’t tell anyone it was him. Hurley, however would give credit to Pablo by giving him an A on his quiz!<n><n>3. Hurley has a new friend named Brad who is much younger than him, but Hurley also feels this new boy is more mature and has more potential. Hurley decided to take Brad in as a friend and try to teach him, but will not tell anyone because he might get into trouble.<n><n>4. Pablo, who is much smarter than Hurley, does not care about grades or his status.<n><n>5. Hurley, meanwhile, will try to hide his true feelings about this new boy.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What do you need to run after ball? Choices:  A: get tired B: have legs C: skip D: not fat E: look first<n>Output:		 You are trying to run past obstacles. You get tired before reaching any of the obstacles, so you must have legs. But not fast legs, not fat legs, not look first fast legs.   In order for you to be fast, your legs must be long.<n><n>Input:Bobby is 12 years old and his parents are very strict. There are things he has to do or he does not get any attention from his parents. He only eats a small amount of chocolate during the day. However, at night he eats a lot of chocolate and sometimes he eats too much. He knows there are some good things, like hot chocolate, but there are not really any special foods. He also knows there are certain foods that his parents won't let him eat because their weight may be affected by it. He wants to eat more nutritious foods, but he has not been able to find many nice or special foods. He wishes the family would stop the strict rules and stop being so strict. He wants healthy food and they will stop being so strict and his parents will stop being so strict.<n>Bobby is the same age as Mary. A few years ago, Mary went to Bobby's house. They were friends, but they did not really see each other too often. Last year, Mary had a boyfriend who was not very healthy. Then, Mary's boyfriend broke up with her because he did not feel the same way she did about health. Now, Mary has decided to go away and live alone. She does not have a house or a car and she has no car. She is afraid of getting a job because she might get bored. Mary is really lonely. So Bobby brought some sweets into Mary's room to comfort her. Bobby made a chocolate chip cookie and he hid it in a special place. He was concerned that Mary would not find it if she tried to look for it in other places. He wanted to surprise Mary and show her that she was his friend. He also wanted to give her some comfort candy from his house. Mary was feeling sad and he was worried about her. He put his chocolate chip cookie in a clear paper bag and hid it in a drawer in Mary's room. He knew that Mary would not notice the snack. But she did notice the bag, and she began to cry. Bobby felt a little bad that she was sad and he did not know what to do. When Mary cried and saw him put the candy in the drawer, Bobby knew she was very lonely and he wanted to be her
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:She was processing the wool, she kept her leg bouncing to operate the what? Choices:  A: hospital bed B: legroom C: spinning wheel D: grand piano E: rhythm<n>Output:		Spinning wheel<n>The following is an example of a musical question.<n>Input:<n>What is the difference between a sieve and a cheese grater?<n>Output:<n>Which of the following is correct?<n>Input: A: sieve B: cheese grater C: drum D: sieve<n>Output: Drum<n>Spinning wheels are used to process wool, while cheese graters use different techniques. Spinning wheels are used to make spinning blankets that are then worn by women. Drummers have drums of their own to play.<n>Input: The first person to reach 100 wishes granted would get...<n>Output: $100,000<n><n>Output: The word “possess” is used in a sentence as “John held the toy up.” The question asks, “What’s wrong with possessing the toy?”<n>Input: The first number to reach 100 wishes granted on Christmas would get...<n>Output; $1,000,000<n><n>Answers:<n>A: the toy is not being held at all - it's being held<n>B: a hand is being used that isn't really holding the toy - it's being held by the feet, if one had a toy that held by the feet, it would be in the hand.<n>C: a hand is being held by a toy that isn't being held at all. the toy itself is being held.<n>D: John held the toy in the "possession" of someone else, not him. He was playing with his toy and the toy owner held it for him.<n>E: John possessed the toy in the possession of someone else, he said so in his note. He didn't just say "hold up" as did the man in the photo.<n><n>Input: A. 1 person B. 2 people C. 20 people<n>Output: B<n>1 person is the first person to reach 100.<n>2 people is the second and third in the first group that reaches 100 after 1 person gets 100.<n>20 people are the four people that reached 100 after all 100 people got 100 after 1 guy got 100<n><n>There is a little girl growing up and she goes with her mom and aunt to the supermarket and says goodbye to her mom and aunt, but the mom and aunt do not say goodbye to her. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:When going to sleep what noise does a human make? Choices:  A: loss of consciousness B: relaxation C: snoring D: dreaming E: talking<n>Output:		 A, C, D, E, talking, dreaming, snoring<n>Which one is correct?<n><n>Consequence: 1) When trying and failing to sleep, people often feel extremely sleepy. 2) When trying and failing too hard to sleep, people often become very awake and talkative. 3) The first of these two scenarios has negative consequences<n><n>Input: A, B, C, D, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q, R, S:<n>Output: B, C, D<n>Input: P, Z, K, M, W, X, Y, Z:<n>Output: All Z<n>Input: A, J, K, B, C, F, G, G, H, H, I, K, M, O, P, R, S: How many people are in this group?<n>Input: P, R, S, S, A, B, G, I, L, M, O<n>Output: All P<n>Input: A, A, O, Q, R, T, U, V: C, A, P, S, S, U<n>Output: All B<n>Input: A, O, Q3, L3, M3, U3, D3<n>Output: All Q3, M3, D3, A3, O3, U3, U<n><n>Input: A1, A2, B1<n>Output: A2<n>Output: A2, B1, A1<n>Consequence: The correct answer is B3, while the incorrect one is Y5<n><n>Input: A2, B2, C1<n>Output: C3<n>Output: C1<n>Consequence; you have to write Y2+C3 so answer is Y2+C3+Y2+C3+C4<n>Input: A2+B2+C1<n>Output: A1<n>Consequences: 1) Only two people, A1 and A2, are left in the correct answer<n><n>Consequence:(i) 1=1 2=1 + 0 2=1 +0<n>Input: P, M, (B1+M2)- K, C<n>Output: P, M<n>Consequence(ii) 1=6 2=6+10 3=10 6-3=10 10-3=10 12-3=
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:It had a beach with shallow water, while not the ocean this was a hot spot all the locals enjoyed on the what? Choices:  A: swimming pool B: pond C: lake D: bathe in E: childrens pool<n>Output:		The beach has shallow water, while not being deep the locals enjoy the swimming pool where the sea animals are more protected.<n><n>Input: It has a beach with shallow water while not the ocean this is a hot spot all the residents enjoy on the what? Chooses:  A: swimming B: pond C: river D: lake E: children's pool<n>Output:The hot spot all the residents love is the swimming pool which is protected during the water season.<n>Output:All of them go to the hot spot in the summer for sun.<n><n>input: It has a beach where all the residents enjoy on what? Chooses: A: swimming B: river D: lake, E: childrens pool, A: childrens pool, C: lake D: river E: children swimming pool<n>Output:The childrens pool with the hot season when all the kids can enjoy<n><n>input: Have 3 people who had attended this school been to this college and worked there? Choose the correct answer.<n>Output:<n><n>Input: Have 3 people who have attended this school been to that school and then worked there? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Wanting to avoid the cabbage spoiling, where did he put it? Choices:  A: grocery store B: refrigerator C: freezer D: plate E: supermarket<n>Output:		 Grocery store A Food C Vegetable D Meat E Shop<n><n>Input:Want to ask someone if they like hamburgers or hot dogs? Who is the first one to score?<n>Output:A: Pitcher 2B: Bullpen 3C: Pitcher 4D: Player 5<n><n>Input:A child enters a daycare. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:In what place could you find air that has been breathed by many people recently? Choices:  A: charming B: space shuttle C: house D: train station E: surface of earth<n>Output:		 A- there would be an active volcano that is in a remote corner of the Philippines  B- there would be a huge cloud of ash  C- there would be a big black hole  D- there would be a cloud of gas    E-  there would be clouds of dust and debris<n>So the final answer for this question is a<n>B<n>E<n><n>Input:<n>Suppose all members of the family, including parents and children, are in a room. There are two rooms connected by a hallway. The first room is completely empty except for a sign on the door:<n>The second room is completely empty except ____________.<n>Output: There is no sign in the hallway<n><n>Input:<n>A very big man walks into a room. He grabs a pencil, a pen, a notebook, a pencil, a pen and a notebook, and starts writing. On the first day, he writes down 100 things. On the second day, he writes down 200,000,000,000, 000 (if you divide by 100) and on the third day he writes down 1,000,000,0000,000 (because one hundred billion is the nearest number to one thousand, if you multiply by 100). After 24 days (for a total of 12 months) and 12,000 days, he makes a list of 20 million ideas. At that point, he writes something down almost every single day for 1.75 billion days – what’s called a journal. What is the total number of entries made into the journal?<n>Output:<n><n>It’s hard to think of an amount that will solve this problem, but here with an idea you can come up with millions of answers. However, after thinking about it for a while, you may give up and come up with an idea of your own. So the answer for this question is 7.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What does a judge do when someone is convicted of a crime? Choices:  A: conduct trial B: arrest C: bring in verdict D: pass sentence E: serve justice<n>Output:		 Conviction means the person was found guilty, which means they must return to court, where they will serve the sentence, which can be up to 5 years. This must be paid for by the person who was convicted, either by them working, or by their family.<n>They must do this to complete their sentence.<n>They can then apply for a pardon, which has to be granted by a President.<n><n>Output: A student who does not belong to a special program comes to class every day, reads every single page in the text book, and pays attention. He also does not miss any of the test days. He has a 98% average. He is ranked number 19 percent in all of his classes. The teacher is concerned because he has never missed a test day or had any test day slip up. The teacher asks him to meet in the library and tell him how he does in his class, what the students need to know to be successful, and who has been helpful. The student is concerned, but he finds that the information they gave does sound good. However, he was concerned because he knew that the teacher did not really know him. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Where is a snake likely to reside? Choices:  A: tropics B: nightmare C: wyoming D: bushes E: feild<n>Output:		 The snake will be in an area where _________ will not be found.<n>Input: A: jungle B: arid C: desert D: desert E: marsh<n>Output: A: swamp B: desert C: jungle D: swamp<n>Input: Where is the best place to get the most fruit? Choices:  a: shop B: market C: farm D: park or forest<n>Output: b: market C: farm<n>Input: What is something people get excited about that they don’t normally get excited about? Choices: 1. Food 2. Money 3. Weapons 4. Clothes 5. Houses 6. Houses<n>Output: Food- People who would give up food for the rest of their lives are called thrifty or hoarders.<n>Weapons- People who would give a weapon for the rest of their life are called weapons hoards<n>Clothes- People who are excited about buying new clothes or even buying clothing that hasn't worn out in years is called thrifts.<n>Houses- People who move often, live in a house for many years or move to a house just for the summer is called move-a-holics.<n><n>Input: a horse and buggy is out in the fields. Each day, there is more corn to harvest. If the crop doesn't dry before the end of the rainstorm season, the farmer will have to pull the horse and buggy to the barn.<n>Output: a farmer goes out every day to pull his horse and buggy but always finds water in the fields. The water is often in the corn from the rains two days ago<n><n>Input: The following are a list of people that meet the following criteria: 1. Live with their parents at home. 2. Have a small town in their town. 3. Have their house inspected by the town board at least once a year. 4. Have a house that is a single story. 5. Have a house that the house has not been vacant for more than 12 months, even if it is under a lease. 6. The home must have a kitchen and a bathroom. 7. The home must have been in the name of someone who is living in the home, and have lived in the home a total of 12 months or longer. 8. No persons on the list have any other houses above it. 9. People on the list cannot be living in more than two residences at the same time. 10. People on the list can not own more than one private vehicle or
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Where does someone not happy to take their car? Choices:  A: down a river B: city C: repair shop D: parking lot E: neighbor's house<n>Output:		 A = down river - city - repair shop B = parking lot - neighbor's house C = house D = neighbor's car E = down river - car - neighbor's neighbor<n>So, the final answer is >city B><n><n>Input: An artist's assistant asked for 500 paintings to be completed at a studio. Each painting was to cost $3.50. How much did each artist charge?<n>Output: Each artist charged $3.50 per painting.<n>So you can sum up each artist's rate at $3.50 each to get:<n>$10,000 - $3.50 = <><n>$10,000 + $3.50 = ><n>$10,000 * 6 = >40<n>So the final answer for this question is >40<n><n>***Please note that this is a quick and dirty question, and that there are many other ways to answer this question.***<n><n>This answer was last modified at 9:45pm, on Monday, August 5, 2013

You can also add small amount of vinegar to sweeten the juice, but a lot of people don’t do that since vinegar is not a fruit. For grape juice canning, you can also make wine and juice. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:In war, your primary method is combat, but your goal is to do what? Choice: I would not want any one to rule me. Choice: I would rather be in charge of my own life and do what I need to do. Choice: I would wish that I had more freedom. Choice: I would still like to be in the know. Choice: I would hate when others try to take my job or be like me. Choice: I think I would do best by doing a lot of everything. Choice: I think you do a lot of things right and I don't want you to keep that from me. Choice: I know that there are many things that I would prefer to do, and for right now, my preference is that I want to work as hard as I can to be perfect. Choice: I know you'll be in the same place as me in the future and if I could choose one thing, I would want to be able to work the same job even though it's not what I prefer to do.<n>Output: Explain the results of the first choice, answer the second, write more about you the person.<n>Input:Why can't I be more like you? You: I love to read and write and have a lot to learn. You: I think you are so neat. You: I like to eat and drink and you know it. You:You are kind and you're smart. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:A person would carry a large netted drawstring bag to what sort of place? Choices:  A: airport B: car C: jewelry store D: garbage can E: laundry room<n>Output:		The person would carry a netted drawstring bag to the airport then to the jewelry store, the car wash and laundry room<n><n>Input:How can you determine which amount to choose to buy in a coin roll if you are holding a whole bunch of different shapes? Select a value from zero to six, order them:<n>Output: You can divide the value of the coin into six numbers and figure the result with the following equation: Number of different shapes = [(6 / 1) * 6 ] x [(6 / 1)/1 ]<n><n>Input:What is the answer to the following problem? How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Where would you read a passage but not write it? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:My house is very dry, with little water in the air. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:The wind tore off the shingles, what was the wind like? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Where is a horse likely to live? Choices:  A: bathroom B: house C: cupboard D: space shuttle E: surface of earth<n>Output:		 First find the air duct, the duct will be in kitchen or bathroom.<n>Next look at where the smell is coming from. It is coming from cupboard which is between the sink and stove.<n>Third, check if the floor is level. If the floor is level, the smell is coming from behind floor near drain.<n>Fourth, check if the floor has nails. If the floor has nails, the smell is coming behind floor near ceiling.<n>Fifth, check if the floor needs fixing. if the floor needs fixing, the smell is coming near ceiling.<n>Sixth, check if the kitchen is ventilated well. If the kitchen is ventilated, the smell is coming form kitchen.<n>Seventh, check if there is any kind of stain on floor. Stain is a sign of something that needs to be fixed.<n>Eighth, check if the carpet needs replacing. If the carpet needs replacing, the smell is coming outside the room.<n>Ninth, check to rule out the above. If none come to the rescue, the smell is coming out of the refrigerator.<n><n>Input:Suppose that a large company produces a book entitled “The Business of a Small Company”. Wearing shoes after the rain does not cause rain to be slippery.<n>It is a good idea to carry a hat or bag to cover your head if you become wet, even with water. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:The doctor recommended washing hands, what was being promoted? Choices:  A: cold hands B: wet floor C: health D: become wet E: dry skin<n>Output:		D=Health.Wet=Cold.Floor=Health.become=Wet.<n>If you wash your hands and become wet, then those hands would have to dry before the next turn, when the doctor would be called, and he would call you a bad liar, because D is bad but W is worse.<n>So the final answers are, D = Health.Wet = Cold.Floor = Health.become=WET.<n>The doctor would be the one to call for your hand washing and the hand washing has to be over and over until you do it at least once a day.<n>And if you let your hands dry and become wet, they would be good again immediately because D is bad but O is ok because O makes you happy.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Where is one likely to purchase listening vinyl? Choices:  A: safeway B: record albums C: record store D: car E: wallpaper<n>Output:		 None of the above<n><n>Input:When someone tries to convince you that you cannot drive, can you tell them that you have successfully mastered this skill for 30 years?<n>Output: Yes<n><n>Input:At what age does a young child have the knowledge of his or her physical and mental abilities?<n>Output: A year old and an adolescent are both physical and mental abilities, therefore the following are not the same.<n><n>Input:What do you think of the following sentences:<n><n>“A man’s job is to take care of his family.”<n>“There is only one race, Caucasian.” (Equality of Rights.)<n>“Our society is progressing but racism and bigotry is still alive and well.”<n>”The world is now moving in the direction of equality between men and women.”<n>‘White supremacy’ was a myth invented by a racist group called the KKK. (Equality)<n>“The government is no place to tell people what to do, not even the government.” (Equal Rights)<n>In what way do you see discrimination? (Equality)<n>What are some examples? (Anti-discrimination/Unfairness. Discrimination)
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What is a student about to do if they are sitting in front of a number of black and white keys? Choices:  A: talk B: read book C: play piano D: study book E: study engineering<n>Output:		 A is probably reading a book. B is probably studying engineering while C is probably talking about a car D is probably playing the piano or studying engineering<n>So the final answer will be E.<n><n>Feedback<n><n>Feedback on this quiz by your teacher should be appreciated.<n><n>We're constantly adding more interactive quizzes for you to take. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What is the purpose of the cabin in an airplane? Otherwise, your answer to the previous question may be completely wrong and a new question need to be started.<n>As an example, you can see that the answer "A" is incorrect in the first example of "what's next." In this case, you need to start the "what's next" question at either "A" or "B" and choose either a second question to answer or the correct answer from this second question, whichever is appropriate to your answer of the first "what's next" topic question. You can change the answers in both the first example of what's next, or the first example of "next topic."<n>So you choose the first example "future examples," as you can see that a death is mentioned here. The question now asks "where would the person's name be placed on the school's honor roll?" If you answer "that person was on the honor roll every semester," then the answer "A" would be very wrong. You should pick "that person" B or C and answer "A" as incorrect. In the

Choices:  A: atom B: anything C: air D: feet E: hands<n>Output:		 An atom is a chemical compound of protons and electrons<n>An atom is a chemical compound with the following elements:  A: hydrogen  B: oxygen C: carbon D: oxygen E: nitrogen F: nitrogen<n>If an atom cannot exist without its nucleus, it must be a particle with its own nucleus. If this is true, atoms are made up of three levels of atoms – protons, electrons and neutrons.<n>An atom is a “charge neutral” molecule because you cannot separate the charge from the rest of the atoms that make up an atom. An atom’s electrons and protons are both together at the same time. Each proton in an atom is attached to a proton and another electron. Each electron in an atom is attached an electron and another proton. An atom is charged because there are two equal but opposite points of attraction for each proton. As the atom moves through space, it creates forces between other atoms.<n><n>Input: An atom contains two protons, an electron (electron is a positively charged particle) and two neutrons. An atom has an atomic nucleus. The atom does not emit or absorb light. How is atomic structure different from its composition?<n>Output: Atomic structure is determined solely by the number of protons, neutrons and electrons in each atom. The number of protons, electrons and ions in each atom determines which atomic structure the atom will have when it exists.<n><n>Input: What would happen if the same people were at the same time, but in different groups. At the party, they are all in groups with a group of six. At the dance, they are all in different groups. Who will go with who at the party in each group? At the dance, groups A and B are in different groups. What combination of the people in a group will they see at the dance?<n>Output: Group A and group B can both see each other, but only one person can be in both groups. Group A is always in group A, group B is always in group B.<n>Groups A and B both went to school on the same side of the country. Their parents go to school in different countries. Group A and group B went to different schools with different teachers. Group A and group are now in

What is twice as large?<n>Output: (x + y) + (-a), when a is twice as large.<n>So the final solution is (x - y) + (-a) (x + y) - (x - y) = (x + y).<n>Output:<n>So the final answer for this question is a.<n><n>Input: If our number is multiplied by three times, the product is four times larger than the product itself. Therefore, if we multiply the last digit by five times, the sum of the numbers is three times smaller than it was before (2 + 4). Let’s make a new number, what’s the first number?<n>Output: (2 + 4) + 7 = (2 + 4) - 5 = (2 - 4) - 7 = -9.<n>Therefore the product of the last 3 numbers is (2 - 4) times larger than the sum itself!<n>Output: 5<n><n>Input: When will a group solve the problem given by input #2?<n>Output: Will a group solve the given problem within 50m?<n>Yes and no; Yes because they can solve it within 40m, and no because it would take them 1,5 hours to solve it in 50m<n><n>Input: Find a square with 3 sides of x and 5 squares of y. Each square is 16cm in width, 6cm in height and 32cm in length. The sides of the rectangles will also be x (16cm) and y (6cm)<n>Output: 4 x 4x32 x x x<n>Output:<n>The last digit is 4<n><n>Input: If a circle is at the middle (the center circle) why can’t it circle around the circumference? Answer: Because the circumference of a circle is the distance from the center circle to the center of the circle. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What do horses do to get energy? Choices:  A: eat grass B: play C: kept in stables D: dominated E: drink coffee<n>Output:		 To get energy from grass, horses eat grass. Horse D takes a nap and is less active. Cat E takes a nap, but is more active.<n>Answer from: http://www.flickr.com/photos/bryan9576083/sets/72157616809909846/<n><n>Input: A boy, 10, wants five $5 bills. How much will he have left over?<n>Output: If he gets $5, he will be $10, he will have $5, $5, $5 and $5.<n>The boy will be $10 + 10 = <<$10+10=20>>20<n>He will have $5 as well as $5 and $5 and only $5.<n>So the final answers is 20<n><n>Input: What are the differences between the two questions?<n>Output: The differences are: $1.50 is $4 less, $0.75 is $8 less than $1.50<n>The difference of $1 is the difference between $7 and $9.<n>The second difference is one less dollar than in question one.<n>The third difference is five dollars<n>The difference of $0.75 is the difference between $8 and $9.<n><n>Input: When did the first airplane leave the ground?<n>Output: Before any of the children knew anything about planes, the first airplane flew out of the ground. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:The museum made an odd choice for the koala display, they put the stuffed creature in what area where you'd usually find a panda? Koalas are extremely active, the only time they have been inactive is when Australia has been struck by an icy storm (such as in 2006). One could not tell this by looking at it due to the red fur. The koala has not heard of electricity and no one has ever seen one, so therefore it was not expected to use it. There are many people that are not allowed to touch the koala, only the museum staff have this power. The koala is constantly getting attacked by flies and so on. So, the koala does not go out into the main zoo area at weekends when most of the other animals do.<n>Output: The museum has decided that the koala should remain where it is. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. The executive assistant then told the employee to call him when it arrived and then hung up. When the employee came back into the office the next day, he said "What did you do?"<n>output: A<n><n>Input:(To read or write) To write a letter - 1 letter:<n>output: 1 letter<n>When it came to writing a letter, I chose to write a letter.<n><n>Input: What are three words that have a connection with each other? Anagram: 1) A/B/C/D/E<n>Output: As A, a B and a C and D.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Mary was a bad girl, but she was always open about that. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Which long saga will we be watching on tonight's program? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:What do you feel from playing football? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:Where can you see a mammoth in NYC? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: museum exhibit C: prehistoric times D: museum of natural history E: forest<n>Output:		 A. At museum exhibits. D. At refrigerator. C. At prehistoric times. E. At forest<n><n>Input: A man was standing in a crowded city street during a holiday parade. He noticed that one boy had been pushed down on a sidewalk. He shouted out to the boy, “Are you okay? Do you need a friend?” The boy ran up the street to get help. How did the other kids react?<n>Output: Most cheered. Some made a wide motion with one hand. A couple were too scared to move at all. So the boy was ignored..<n><n>Input: The first person you meet when arriving in the school parking lot is Ms. Jones. Ms. Jones asks how you are and then asks at the same time, "What do you want to do as soon as you get home?" Why did this person bother to tell you what the first person asked you about? What is the best answer?<n>Output: Tell me.<n><n>Input: A baby duck is playing in the water but he is afraid of water. His mother comes to help him out of the water. First he tells his mother the reason why he doesn’t like the water. Then his mother asks him some fun questions to get his mind off the water. After Mr. and Mrs. Duck had gone to do a house clean-up Mrs. Duck took the baby duck back to the water to swim again. The baby duck was feeling relieved because he got to swim while the mother helped him! If what his mother told him had been true, why did the duck not play in the water again after his mother helped him out of the water? If you were a duck why would you be afraid of drowning? (Answer A or D will be right)<n>Output: Tell me!
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input:When having food at a formal place, what do you usually do? Choices:  A: sit B: being sociable C: talk D: drinking E: medium<n>Output:		 E and D<n><n>Input: What is the probability of getting each question correct? 1001/1002<n>Output: I'm not sure. I can be sure that the probability is 0/1000<n><n>Input: The sun in the west is now on the equator and so is the sun in the east, when will the equator rise?<n>Output: There is still 0 sun in the east<n><n>Input: A boy and a girl have been in class for an hour and 20 minutes. The boy says he can't understand a word the girl is saying to him and thinks she's lying. The girl thinks he's a liar. The teacher says the boy should wait for the girl to leave the room before speaking to him. How many minutes have passed since the start of the class?<n>Output: Two hours and 20 minutes<n><n>Input: A man is getting his stomach pumped and is worried it isn't deep enough. He is told by a fellow patient that he had six holes, one in each of his legs. The man begs for more morphine. The doctor informs him it will take at least an hour to get the additional morphine through the intestine and into the man's body. The man asks: how can you know that? The doctor replies: I can't think of anything else that would cause me to feel more numb than a hole in my stomach. The man protests and says that his stomach is not getting any fatter. The doctor assures him that he won't lose any more weight after surgery if he didn't already have a BMI of 42%. Then the doctor proceeds to talk to the patient about weight loss. The man starts to get agitated and says he will not lose weight. The doctor informs the man that he's going to try to get him to lose 50 pounds. The patient's eyes fill up with tears and he can't believe that this kind man is giving him so much pain. The doctor responds with a stern words:<n>You will lose weight if you continue on this path.<n>The man begins to sob uncontrollably while begging the doctor not to leave him hanging. The man can't believe that he is at the mercy of this doctor who knows all that he needs to know about weight loss. The doctor refuses to help the man and tells him that he has to lose weight if he wants to continue living and get away from the pain. The man feels like yelling out the doctor's name to get him to stop. The man turns to his girlfriend who had just gotten home in tears
